section.title: Overview
section.para: This is a module which provides a FIFO transport layer implementation for Management Interface.

section.title: FIFO command syntax
section.para:
The external commands issued via FIFO interface must follow the following syntax:
request = first_line argument*
first_line = ':'command_name':'reply_fifo'\n'
argument = (arg_name '::' (arg_value)? ) | (arg_value)
arg_name = not-quoted_string
arg_value = not-quoted_string | '"' string '"'
not-quoted_string = string - {',",\n,\r}

section.title: External Libraries or Applications

none

section.title: fifo_name (string)
section.para: The name of the FIFO file to be created for listening and reading external commands.

section.title: fifo_mode (integer)
section.para: Permission to be used for creating the listening FIFO file. It follows the UNIX conventions.

section.title: fifo_group (integer) fifo_group (string)
section.para: Group to be used for creating the listening FIFO file.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one.

section.title: fifo_user (integer) fifo_group (string)
section.para: User to be used for creating the listening FIFO file.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one.

section.title: reply_dir (string)
section.para: Directory to be used for creating the reply FIFO files.

section.title: reply_indent (string)
section.para: Strings to be used for line indentation. As the MI data structure is tree oriendeted, the depth level will printed as indentation.

section.title: Exported Functions
section.para: No function exported to be used from configuration file.
